parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A reduplicated and contracted form of peto; probably akin to petomai through the idea of alighting; to fall.
From pros and ops; the front, i.e. The countenance, aspect, appearance, surface; by implication, presence, person.
Gen: from; dat: beside, in the presence of; acc: alongside of.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
The foot. A primary word; a 'foot'.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From eucharistos; to be grateful, i.e. to express gratitude; specially, to say grace at a meal.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
A Samaritan. From Samareia; a Samarite, i.e. Inhabitant of Samaria.
